head.note: This manuscript contains: John Chrysostom. The commencement of the first discourse of John Chrysostom toTheodore. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.author: John Chrysostom
msItem.title: The commencement of the first discourse of John Chrysostom toTheodore
msItem.rubric: ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܡܪܝ ܝܘܚܢܝܣ. ܐܦܣܩܘܦܐ ܕܩܘܣܛܢܛܝܢܦܘܠܘܣ. ܕܥܠ ܬܝܒܘܬܐ. ܕܒܗ̇ ܐܪܬܝ ܠܡ̇ܢ ܕܢܦ̣ܠ ܡܢ ܩܝܡܗ.

physDesc.p: A vellum leaf, about 8 3/8 in. by 5 3/8, much mutilated. The writing is a small, neat Estrangělā of the vith or viith cent.

handNote.desc: The writing is a small, neat Estrangělā of thevith or viith cent.

item.p: On the recto there is some ancient Arabic writing, now much effaced.

head.note: This manuscript contains: John II of Alexandria. Part of a letter, containing a confession of faith, addressed toPhiloxenus of Mabūg, probably by John II of Alexandria; Philoxenus of Mabūg. The reply of Philoxenus; Philoxenus of Mabūg. A short extract from Philoxenus on the Union of the two Natures; John II of Alexandria. The commencement of a discourse on the true faith, addressed to the people by John II of Alexandria. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 4 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.author: John II of Alexandria
msItem.title: Part of a letter, containing a confession of faith, addressed toPhiloxenus of Mabūg, probably by John II of Alexandria

msItem.incipit: ܚܝ̈ܝ ܕܝܠܝ̣ ܐܘ ܐܚ̈ܝ̣ ܡܫܝܚܐ ܗܘ. ܚܕܘܬܐ ܓܝܪ ܕܚܝ̈ܝ ܐܢܬܘܢ ܐܝܬܝܟܘܢ̣. ܐܝܟ ܕܟܬܝܒ. ܡܢܘ ܓܝܪ ܣܒܪܢ ܘܚܕܘܬܢ̇ ܐܘ ܟܠܝܠܐ ܕܫܘܒܗܪܢ. ܐܠܐ ܐܢ ܐܢܬܘܢ ܩܕܡ ܐܠܗܐ ܐܒܘܢ . . .

physDesc.p: Four vellum leaves, about 8 1/4 in. by 5 1/4, all of which are much soiled and more or less torn (Add. 14,670, foll. 19—22). There are from 30 to 32 lines in each page. The writing is a fine, regular Estrangela of the vith or viith cent.

item.p: All of the leaves are much soiled and more or less torn.

layout.p: There are from 30 to 32 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: The writing is a fine, regular Estrangela of thevith or viith cent.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.

category.catDesc: Catenae Patrum and Demonstrations against Heresies
Councils of the Church and Ecclesiastical Canons

revisionDesc.change: CHANGED: added or corrected folio extent values
CHANGED: updated incorrect form and/or material support designation
ADDED: supplied and corrected Syriaca.org URIs for authors
Added generic msItem title(s) based on ancestor title
One or more msParts need to be encodedinto an historical reconstruction of a no longer extant manuscript.
Changed: Files moved to srophe-app-data/data/manuscripts/tei repository.
